results.title: A Gift to grow on
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie and U.S. Committee for UNICEF
results.brief_description: The United Nations Children’s Fund. US committee for UNICEF gets ready for its biggest workload. This documentary explains to young children exactly where this money goes. Its example: a poor town in Mexico where UNICEF provides medical help, education and entertainment.

results.title: Birth reborn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forty Minutes”.
Looks at the work in France of Dr Michael Odent who firmly opposes standard medical thinking on childbirth practices. He advocates that women should be able to give birth in the position in which they feel most comfortable rather than being forced into the “stranded beetle” (legs in stirrups) position commonly used in hospitals. Shows a series of births in which Dr Odent helps women to give birth naturally and with a minimum amount of pain. Also depicts the work of Dr Odent in his pre-birth classes where he encourages women to give birth in different positions: standing or squatting. Suitable for middle and upper secondary, and tertiary levels.

results.title: Lost in a crowd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forty Minutes”.
In this essay on loneliness, five characters in search of someone are sitting on a train. The film shows how each has unsuccessfully tried to remedy their situation. All five share a common problem yet as the train goes down the line not a word is spoken.

results.title: A Future for the past
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.

results.title: A Frog's life
results.brief_description: After collecting frog spawn from a river and putting it into a tank, young children observe the hatching of the spawn and the development of the tadpoles into frogs. Close-up photography is used in recording the gradual change in the frog’s development.

results.title: A Friendly game
results.brief_description: A study and interpretation of the racist and capitalist philosophies. Two men, one white and one black, engage in a chess game, the stakes being $100 if the white man wins and the white man’s expensive chess set if he loses. At first the white man thinks the whole bet is silly since he appears to be winning. But, as the tables turn he becomes more and more upset until he loses and is unwilling to give up his chess set.

results.title: A Flickering light in the darkness
results.creator_credit: The Film Front and Tricontinental Film Center
results.brief_description: First in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western civilisation. This episode shows Europe emerging from the Dark Ages into a feudal maze of dukedoms and bishoprics. Covers the emergence of a new class - the merchants, and the development of new trade routes. Suitable for lower secondary levels.
